You can easily paste plots as vectorial image in your &WYSIWYG; editor:
Check option Do action to copy the plot &EMF; image in the clipboard Switch to your editor and place cursor in the desired position Paste the &EMF; file (CTRL+V)

∓ provides functions to ease data comparison. Suppose you want compare two set of data, for example two oscilloscope acquisition of the same quantities done at different conditions, stored in the two files data1.txt and data2.txt. To compare them, first load these data in two different frames; you can do that either by drag and drop, or by action, or by command line typing:
C:\> MattPlot data1.txt C:\> MattPlot @data2.txt
The prefix @ in the second call prevents a further instance of ∓.
Now we have two frames each containing a data set; we can synchronize frames physical space using or actions.
At this point operations on frames like or are spread on all frames.
